meanings.definition: A person who specializes in Jewish law.
meanings.sent1: The halakhist studied Jewish law diligently.
meanings.sent2: The halakhist provided valuable insights into Jewish legal matters.
meanings.sent3: The halakhist joked that even the Torah couldn't keep up with his expertise.
meanings.sent4: In the world of Jewish law, the halakhist was a shining beacon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Every synagogue sought the guidance of the halakhist in matters of tradition.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Jewish legal interpretation.
meanings.sent1: Her halakhist perspective shed light on the intricate details of Jewish law.
meanings.sent2: The community respected his halakhist views on legal matters.
meanings.sent3: The halakhist approach to law was both insightful and practical.
meanings.sent4: His halakhist interpretation of the Torah brought new understanding to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The halakhist teachings were deeply rooted in the traditions of Judaism.
